Apple___Apple_scab.remediation: Remove and destroy fallen leaves, prune infected twigs, and apply fungicides such as captan or mancozeb during the growing season.

Apple___Black_rot.remediation: Prune out and burn infected branches, remove mummified fruit, and apply fungicides like thiophanate-methyl.

Apple___Cedar_apple_rust.remediation: Remove nearby cedar trees if possible, apply fungicides early in the season, and use resistant apple varieties.

Apple___healthy.remediation: No action required, maintain regular orchard care practices.

Blueberry___healthy.remediation: Healthy plant, continue with routine irrigation, mulching, and pest monitoring.

Cherry___Powdery_mildew.remediation: Improve air circulation, avoid overhead irrigation, and spray sulfur-based fungicides if needed.

Cherry___healthy.remediation: No issues detected, keep monitoring and provide balanced fertilization.

symptoms: Gray to tan rectangular lesions on leaves
Corn___Cercospora_leaf_spot Gray_leaf_sp.remediation: Rotate crops, use resistant hybrids, and apply fungicides such as strobilurins if infection is severe.

Corn___Common_rust.remediation: Plant resistant varieties, rotate crops, and apply fungicides if infection spreads widely.

symptoms: Large cigar-shaped tan lesions on leaves
Corn___Northern_Leaf_Blight.remediation: Use resistant hybrids, practice crop rotation, and apply fungicides if needed.

Corn___healthy.remediation: No issues found, continue with regular care and irrigation.

Grape___Black_rot.remediation: Prune and remove infected parts, destroy mummified berries, and apply fungicides like myclobutanil.

Grape___Esca_(Black_Measles).remediation: Prune infected vines, avoid injuries, and replace severely infected plants with healthy stock.

symptoms: Angular brown lesions with yellow halo
Grape___Leaf_blight_(Isariopsis_Leaf_Spo.remediation: Remove and destroy infected leaves, apply protective fungicides, and ensure good airflow.

Grape___healthy.remediation: Healthy vine, continue pruning and proper irrigation.

Orange___Haunglongbing_(Citrus_greening).remediation: Remove and destroy infected trees, control psyllid insect vectors, and plant disease-free stock.

symptoms: Dark spots on leaves and fruit
Peach___Bacterial_spot.remediation: Plant resistant cultivars, prune for better airflow, and apply copper-based sprays.

Peach___healthy.remediation: No signs of disease, maintain irrigation and fertilization.

Pepper_bell___Bacterial_spot.remediation: Use certified disease-free seeds, apply copper sprays, and avoid overhead watering.

Pepper_bell___healthy.remediation: Plant is healthy, continue with standard nutrient management.

Potato___Early_blight.remediation: Rotate crops, destroy infected debris, and spray fungicides like chlorothalonil.

Potato___Late_blight.remediation: Apply protective fungicides, avoid overhead irrigation, and destroy infected plants.

Potato___healthy.remediation: No disease present, keep monitoring and maintain soil health.

Raspberry___healthy.remediation: No action required, provide trellising and mulching as routine care.

Soybean___healthy.remediation: Healthy crop, maintain irrigation and pest monitoring.

Squash___Powdery_mildew.remediation: Improve ventilation, avoid water stress, and use sulfur or potassium bicarbonate sprays.

Strawberry___Leaf_scorch.remediation: Remove infected leaves, use resistant varieties, and apply fungicides when necessary.

Strawberry___healthy.remediation: Plant is healthy, continue mulching and irrigation management.

Tomato___Bacterial_spot.remediation: Use pathogen-free seeds, apply copper fungicides, and rotate crops regularly.

Tomato___Early_blight.remediation: Remove infected leaves, apply fungicides like chlorothalonil, and rotate crops.

Tomato___Late_blight.remediation: Destroy infected plants, apply fungicides like mancozeb, and avoid wet conditions.

symptoms: Yellow patches on upper leaf surface
Tomato___Leaf_Mold.remediation: Improve ventilation, stake plants, and apply fungicides if spread is severe.

symptoms: Small circular spots with dark borders
Tomato___Septoria_leaf_spot.remediation: Remove affected leaves, avoid overhead watering, and apply fungicides.

Tomato___Spider_mites Two-spotted_spider.remediation: Spray with miticides or insecticidal soap, encourage natural predators like ladybugs.

Tomato___Target_Spot.remediation: Remove infected debris, rotate crops, and use fungicides if needed.

Tomato___Tomato_Yellow_Leaf_Curl_Virus.remediation: Control whitefly vectors, remove infected plants, and use resistant varieties.

Tomato___Tomato_mosaic_virus.remediation: Remove and destroy infected plants, disinfect tools, and avoid tobacco handling near plants.

Tomato___healthy.remediation: Plant is healthy, continue proper irrigation, staking, and pest monitoring.
